content.text:
# Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series

}}
The Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series is an award given by the Screen Actors Guild to honor the finest female acting achievement in a comedy series. Actresses are eligible for the award whether they appear in leading or supporting roles in their respective programs.
Julia Louis-Dreyfus holds the record for both the most wins (5) and nominations (12). She won twice for playing Elaine Benes in Seinfeld (1996, 1997) and thrice for playing Selina Meyer in Veep (2013, 2016, 2017). Tina Fey has earned four wins for her role as Liz Lemon in 30 Rock. Actresses who received seven nominations include Edie Falco, Tina Fey and Megan Mullally.
Winners and nominees
won for Mad About You (1994)]]
won for Cybill (1995)]]
won for Tracey Takes On... (1998)]]
won playing Phoebe Buffay in Friends (1999)]]
won for Sex and the City (2000)]]
won thrice for Will & Grace (2001–2003)]]
won for Desperate Housewives (2004)]]
won for Desperate Housewives (2005)]]
won for Ugly Betty (2006)]]
won four times playing Liz Lemon in 30 Rock (2007–2009, 2012)]]
won twice for Hot in Cleveland (2010, 2011)]]
won five times, twice for Elaine Benes in Seinfeld (1996, 1997), and thrice for Selina Meyer in Veep (2013, 2016–2017)]]
won twice for Orange is the New Black (2014–2015)]]
won for The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel (2018)]]
won for Fleabag (2019)]]
won for ''Schitt's Creek (2020)]]
won thrice for Hacks (2021–2022)]]
won for The Bear (2023)]]
